# Draft:Edward V. Gulbekian

Edward Vahé Gulbekian (born Tajirian-Gulbenkian; January 5, 1930 – April 27, 1994) resided in the London area and published a number of articles in the field of Armenian Studies. He earned an M.S.C. Degree in Chemistry from the University of London.
Biography
Edward (Yedvard) Vahé Gulbekian (Gulbenkian) was born in France in 1930, the only son of Archbishop Mashtots' Tajirian of Etchmiadzin and Hrip'simé Gulbenkian an unusual circumstance because of his father's advance to high office in a church which practices episcopal celibacy. He came to London with his mother in 1935 and after a dispute with the Gulbenkian family adopted a form of surname without the medial n.
He earned an M.S.C. Degree in Chemistry from the University of London and contributed articles to the Ararat Quarterly, The Armenian Review, Le Muséon, Handes Amsorya, Bazmavēp and RAFT: A Journal of Armenian Poetry and Criticism.
When an Armenian preacher asked his congregation to pray for those Armenians fallen in the war in Nagorno-Karabagh, Gulbekian demanded to know why the same thought was given to fallen Azerbaijanis.

* "The Poles and Armenians in Hitler's Political Thinking". The Armenian Review. Vol. 41, No. 3 (Autumn 1988).
* "Measures of Length in Armenian Medieval Texts". Handes Amsorya. (1–12) (1989): 81–92.
* "Why the Third Year of Diocletian?". ''Le Museon: Revue d'Études Orientales. 103 (3–4) (1990): 249–54.
* "Why Did Herodotus Think the Armenians Were Phrygian Colonists?" The Armenian Review''. Vol. 44, No. 3/175 (Autumn 1991): 65–70.

* "Neither Asleep Nor Awake". Bazmavēp. (1993): 265–269.
Book chapters

Books
* "The European intellectual background to Hitler's racial policy" (1994).
* Armenian Sacred and Folk Music / Komitas; translated by Edward Gulbekian ; introduction by V.N. Nersessian. Richmond : Curzon, 1998.
